Title: Men Who Stare at Goats, The
Author: Peter Straughan
Jon Ronson

Replies.Reply: Boone?
I'm going into the next office.
Damn it!
I have been having ideas, gentlemen. Challenging ideas. And when I thought about these ideas I thought about who in the U.S Army would be most receptive to my challenging ideas.
You are, gentlemen. Special Forces.
I want to talk to you about Mind Wars, gentlemen. War...With...
How'd you like to be able to do this? What if you could teach soldiers to do this? Would you be interested?
Or, or let's say you have a unit operating outside the protection of mainline units. What happens if someone gets hurt? How do you deal with that?
Psychic healing! Protect the unit with hands-off healing. Using the mind to heal.
Physicists go nuts when I say that!
Animals! Stopping the hearts of animals! This is the idea I'm coming to you with. You have access to animals right?
Yes General?
Yes sir.
No sir. We don't have access to animals.

Yoga is not the business of the US Army, ladies. Drumming circles are not the business of the Army. And love and peace is most certainly not the business of the Army. So you girls better start thinking about how you CAN engage in the business of the United States Army, which, in case you have forgotten, involves winning fucking wars!
I bet he wasn't.
We have men who can do this?
But we don't have the resources.
Holy shit.
Take out number four.
Goat number four?
In 1983, when Special Forces told General Putkin that they weren't interested in his ideas...that was a lie.
And when they told him they didn't have access to animals...that was also a lie.
The hundred goats in the disused hospital building had been secretly flown in from Central America so as to avoid customs.

My name is Bob Wilton. Imagine me back in Michigan, where I was born and raised. I studied journalism at Western in Kalamazoo and then I got a job at the Ann Arbor Daily Telegram. I wrote a lot of stories about competitive food eating contests.
My wife, Debora, told me later that Ron's death had been like a wake-up call for her - what people used to call a memento mori.
It seemed like such a tragedy at the time. We couldn't see beyond our little lives to the great events of history unfolding out there in the world.
Had I known where that path would lead, had a soft wind from my future brought me the name of Bill Django, I might never have gone.
Yeah, no it's been...well, I won't lie to you Debora - it's been pretty damn hairy.
Yeah, it's not, uh... I've seen things that you shouldn't, you know...
Pretty damn hairy.
Well, I think it's important people get an accurate picture of what's...
...what's, uh, happening, so...is that Dave?
Oh, that's, that's...
Okay. Gotta go. We're moving out -
Yeah.
I've been stuck here. They've only just given me the green-light. So I'll probably head over there soon. I'm just working on this story about American contractors coming over for the re-build.
Yeah, I think they didn't want me going over because I'm not embedded.
So what's a useful phrase?
What's that mean?
Hey.
DeWitt Resources. Arkansas.
You over here for the conference?
What's your pitch?
Bob Wilton.
Could I bum a smoke, Skip?
Oh crap, can't find my...
Lyn Cassady...?
Right here?
Wandering?
So what have you seen lately?
Okay. Wow.
So...when did this all start for you Gus?
Right. I don't know who that is.
So what did you do in the army?
You mean, what...with your...?
Huh. What kind of animals?
say.
Well, I've never owned a hamster Gus, so I don't know what...
Maybe some of the readers have hamsters so...
Yeah, I guess any hamster-owning readers will know what's aberrant behavior and, uh, what's...Oh, shit, he's down!
Oh my God! You've dropped both hamsters!
Well...it didn't die. I thought you said you killed it?
Who's the Skipper?
Do you...do you know a Gus Lacey?
Whoa!
Hooper? No. I work for the Ann Arbor Daily Telegram.
I interviewed him a few years ago.
He said he joined Bill Django's unit in the army and was trained to, to, uh remote view?
And he said the Loch Ness Monster was the ghost of a dinosaur. Who's Bill Django?
Yes.
Are you...? Do you mean you corroborate his, uh...? Because, see, I thought he was just an idiot?
But you're saying there was a secret unit?
Um...brown?
A Super Soldier?
What's a Jedi Warrior?
You're a Jedi Warrior?
What does that...? I don't think  I...
You've got super powers?
Hold on, let me...let me just...
Okay, so, so you're saying you were a Psychic Spy, like Lacey?
How does that work?
What about you?
What other powers did you practise?
Invisibility?
Actual invisibility?
Like camouflage?
you...I wanna...could I write a story about this?
No, but see, I've been looking for a story Lyn. I was going to write about the re-build contracts but this...this is even better and  I...
All I'm saying is we could talk some more tomorrow and...
You're going home?
Oh.
I could come.
I could come with you, maybe, and...
No, listen, we could change names, stuff could stay off record and...
Well you know, you don't...
A journalist. I go where the story is.
What? Nothing. I was just doodling.
What's the matter?
The U.S Army doesn't really have any serious alternative than to be Wonderful!
The New Earth Army is a banner under which the forces of good can gather. The courage and nobility of the Warrior, blended with the spirituality of the Monk.
The Jedi Warrior will follow in the footsteps of the great Imagineers of the past - Jesus Christ, Lao Tse Tung, Walt Disney...
The role of The New Earth Army is to RESOLVE CONFLICT world-wide.
What's the sparkly eyes technique?
Okay.
Who is this Bill Django?

Every single one of Bill's men fired high. They instinctively hadn't wanted to shoot another person. Later Bill would come across a study by General S.L.A Marshall, which revealed that only 15-20 percent of fresh soldiers shot to kill. The rest aimed high, didn't fire at all, or pretended to be busy doing something else.

Recovering in hospital, Bill wrote to General T.L Cornplow, Vice Chief of Staff for the Army, explaining that he wanted to go on a fact-finding mission to explore alternative combat tactics. The Pentagon agreed to pay his salary and expenses for the duration of the journey.

What Bill hadn't told the Pentagon was that he was really looking for the answer to the riddle of his vision. How could his men's gentleness, their general lack of interest in killing people, how could this be turned into a strength? How could love and peace help win wars? Bill knew where to go to find out.
Bill disappeared into the New Age Movement for six years.
Like all Shamen before him, he had traversed the wilderness. Now he was returning to his people, a changed man.
Does it direct your powers?
The cone. Does it direct your psychic powers or something?
What does it do?
He stops.
Nothing.
Well it's just...it's hard to believe the Pentagon paid for this. I mean, it's very interesting, but there's nothing in here that's actually about...fighting?
Non-lethals?
Before he can finish Lyn has slipped Bob's finger into a hole in the middle of the blob and twisted it.
OH! OH FUCK! OH...FUCK!
OWWWWWW!
Stop it! Stop hurting me!
I think it's officially night now.

Amongst Bill's audience that night was Brigadier General Dean Hopgood, from the Defense Intelligence Agency. For some time the General had been concerned about information he had been receiving about Soviet research into psychic powers.
According to some stories the Soviets were psychically spying on American bases and had designed "psychotronic generators" - machines capable of bombarding the President with negative energy.
They were also conducting sadistic experiments to see whether animals had psychic powers.
Could they, for instance, telepathically detect that their babies were distressed?
Two weeks later the Army adopted the slogan Be All You Can Be and appointed Bill Commander of the first New Earth Army Battalion.
Lyn?
Oh God. Oh God.
LYYYYN!
I didn't...I thought...What are you doing?
What are you doing?
Really? Which one?
That one?
Isn't that one too far away?
Jesus Lyn. You had like the whole desert to drive in...
Right.
Right.
What's your record at this?
Right. That's pretty...
Oh thank Christ.
Can you help us? We drove into a rock. Could you take us to a town or someplace?
Thank you! Thanks so much!
Hi! Hello there. Thanks so much for this.
Don't know if we would have lasted much longer. Phew!
Yeah, it gets pretty hot out here, huh?
Oh, you speak English? Great. Deep Purple. Right. You guys like Deep Purple? You like rock or, or...
Lyn? Is this...is this...?
We're going to die! I'm going to be killed by Al Qaeda!
Oh what the hell do you know? You don't know! You don't know anything! And this is all your fault!
I got drunk and I just wanted to get into Iraq so I could prove to my wife I wasn't...just once that I...And now I'm going to die.
How are we gonna stop them?
What do you mean?
What do you mean?
We haven't got a pen.
Oh...I don't want to Lyn.
I don't think I...there's sharp edges around here...
What's with the quotation fingers?
Well, if I choose to choke you, what are you going to do?
Sharp...edges...
Yes.
I don't know. I was pretty terrified anyway but the fear I felt on the run-up to the choking did seem, you know, unusual.
I'm sorry I freaked out, Lyn.
Huh.
for DeWitts?
Gus Lacey said you ran a dance studio. That was just cover too, right?
on a mission out here?
Were you just kidding me back there - about me having some Jedi in me?
Yes.
Do you really think so?
Yes. Yes I have.
Have you always had powers?
Why?
After years of feeling like an oddball Lyn had finally found a home. At last he was amongst men who prided themselves on being different.
These were Golden Days for Lyn.
Larry Hooper was a failed Sci-Fi writer from Colorado, recruited to the Jedis after Brigadier General Hopgood met him at a spoon-bending party.
Right from the start he had made himself unpopular with the other Jedis.
Larry made it quite clear that he despised most of the other Jedis.

After a year's training, Lyn was given his first tasking. A senior Nato General had been kidnapped by Red Brigade members in Italy. Bill was unofficially asked if his unit would be able to help find him before it was too late.
It's true that the unit never found out whether any of their remote viewings were accurate or not. Nevertheless from that moment on Lyn's reputation soared.

The word soon got out in the intelligence community that there was a sergeant at Fort Bragg who could find whatever you needed found. It was as if Lyn could fly anywhere in the world without leaving his room.
Lyn?
Are you going to use the Blob?
Shit...shit...
La termi, ana sahafi!
Ben Echmeyer was a Vietnam vet with sixty-three confirmed kills.
Another demonstration involved letting a recruit drive a jeep over him. This, in the end, was to be his undoing.
The approach was hailed by some knife aficionados as revolutionary but criticized by others who believed that the leaping and spinning might lead you to accidentally stab yourself.
Of course, Lyn didn't actually have a knife with him at this particular time...so I still think what he did was kinda...reckless.
They're not coming! We're okay! Oh God, we're gonna be okay!
What happened?
Oh shit! Oh shit, they're coming!
Sounds good Muhammad.
Muhammad led us to his home which it turned out had been robbed in his absence.
I understood he was going     through a lot, but considering we     had saved him from kidnappers     I still thought his welcome could     have been a little warmer.
Lyn?
What are you thinking?
Lyn was thinking of Larry Hooper and the part he had played in the destruction of the New earth Army.
Or there was the time Major General Gilling was visiting the base and saw Jedi trainee Clifford Hickox...
...practising the ancient Sun Dance of the Sioux Nation.

The Jedis survived such minor scandals, protected, it was rumored, by a President who was a fan of both the Star Wars films and the paranormal himself. But then, one summer, a young, likeable Lieutenant called Norman Pendleton was recruited to the New Earth Army...
Larry Hooper wasted no time befriending the newcomer.
All he needed was a lab rat to try them out on, check if they were safe.
It turned out they weren't.
Norm's father, who it turned out was pretty high up in the Pentagon, wanted blood.
Brigadier General Hopgood resigned and died some years later. Bill received a dishonorable discharge.
After Bill left, Major Holtz of Special Forces took command of the Jedis.
Jesus Christ. We could'a bought a map if you'd said.
Well?
Well...use your watch.
Oh for the love of...Here...
What?
So? That's...
Well how the hell am I supposed to know?
You're the navigation expert here.
Turns out you haven't even got a watch! Now what the hell are we...
What?
Just...instant?
WE'VE BEEN SITTING HERE FOR HALF  AN HOUR! HOW'S THAT "INSTANT?"
Oh, it's that way?
Right. Now you know.
What...what happened?
What?
Oh Jesus.
I can't believe this. Great fucking intuition Lyn. I can't...put me down. I can walk.
Oh, Jeez. Oh, Jeez.
Where are we going? We should stay with the car so the army can find us.
What are you doing?
Are they my glasses?
Jesus, it's hot. I'm so hot.
Aren't you hot?
I can't breathe properly. I can't...Oh boy...
I think I'm bleeding to death.
If we'd stayed at the road we would be safe now! Now we've got no water, no food or, or...
Will you forget about the fucking tantric currents?
Stop saying that! I just got blown up! I'm in the middle of a desert!
know what color the seats were in the frigging hotel but you can't...you wanna observe something Lyn? Observe the fucking bomb in the middle of the road!
Wait a minute. That's west. Al Qaim's in that direction. We're going the wrong way.
Where?
Is that...is that...is that a joke? We've come six hundred miles and you don't know where we're going?
Who gave you the mission Lyn?
Lyn?
What?
Oh...Oh Jesus.
Oh Jesus. Oh Jesus Lyn. There's no mission? We're in the middle of the desert because you heard voices? There's no one here!
Lyn!
Is it the Crohns?
What's the matter with you?
What curse?
Who destroyed it?
When the dust of the Pendleton Affair had settled it revealed a surprising victor.
Major Holtz regarded Larry Hooper as a patriotic whistle-blower and the one sound fruit in an otherwise dubious barrel of apples.
Goat Lab was originally created as a clandestine laboratory to provide in-the-field surgical training for Special Forces soldiers.
But it turned out most soldiers didn't feel good shooting dogs in the leg...
...whereas the army had long felt fine about doing stuff to goats -
Huh?
So, it's not that the goat fought back?
But...that was it?
Lyn said he had no intention of killing the goat.
Collateral damage?
The silence of the goats.
But before he could leave Larry arranged one last parting gift.
The Dim Mak?
What does the Death Touch do?
Jesus.
Then and there?
Lyn?
Lyn? Where are you going?
Lyn!
I don't think we should...
Psy for psychic?
"American Soldier - your wives are back home having sex with Bart Simpson and Bert Reynolds."
If this is Psyops what are you doing here?
"Sick?"
There's a subliminal message in this?
What? What is it?
What are you going to do?
Lyn? What are you going to do?
Oh, you're not dying! I don't believe you can kill someone with a mail order Dim Sum. You can't...
Whatever. I don't believe you can just...
Bill doesn't answer.
The man crossed a desert to see you again.
You know, he told me all these stories about Bill Django, and I was pretty excited to meet you, but I've gotta tell you...you're one big disappointment.
He told me to give you that back.
What isn't?
That isn't true. That isn't true.
Bill? Bill are you okay?
Timothy Leary's dead.
Don't eat the jello.
Don't eat the jello.
We put LSD in the jello.
Bill showed me where Larry had bottles of LSD. So we put it in the jello mix last night.
What?
But...we've drunk the water.
Don't you think it might have been more sensible if we hadn't drunk the fucking water?
Wait! Wait for me! Where are you going...what about the mission?
At the time I was hurt that Lyn hadn't taken me with him. But now I know it was because he and Bill had already seen what was to come.

Nobody knows exactly what happened. The official story is that their helicopter must have crashed, either because they were hit by an RPG or because...well, that's what happens when you fly a helicopter while you're tripping on acid. All I know is they've never been seen since. Like all Shaman they returned to the sky.
When I got back home I wrote the story up. Everything.
I sent it to the newspapers, the radio stations, the TV stations, because that was what Lyn wanted me to do. The people needed to know.
I was ready for whatever they would do to me. I was ready to disappear. I was ready to go to prison. I was a Jedi and I was fighting for the New Earth Army.
But they didn't put me in prison. They did something much worse.

That was it. That was the only bit of my story that ran anywhere. And it was a joke. And if I ever needed proof of how the Dark Side have taken the beautiful dream of what a nation could be and had twisted it, destroyed it, that was it.
But I won't stop. I won't give up.
Now, more than ever, we need the Supermen.
Americans are a resolute people, who have risen to every test of our time. Adversity has revealed the character of our country, to the world, and to ourselves...
American troops pull down a huge statue of Saddam Hussein in central Baghdad. An American flag draped over the head is hastily replaced by an Iraqi flag.
Yeah. We've been watching it on Fox.
Replies.Didascalie: (O.S.) (over phone, not as concerned as Bob would like)

Replies.Reply: Well I don't even know why you're there. You're not exactly war correspondent material are you?
What? Yeah.
Yeah. He says Hi.
You missed the war?
How?
Yeah, they don't like the unilats.
Went into Baghdad with Charlie Company, Second Brigade, Third Infantry Division...
Could say that. Technicals all the way, RPG's, fuckers were firing anti-aircraft guns at us...
you form a bond with the soldiers.
You see action?
The thunder run? Heard you had it pretty bad.
You know a Private First Class Zuchero?
Zook? I was standing next to him when he took a hit...
La termi, ana sahafi.
Don't shoot, I'm a reporter.
Hey.
Right. We make trash cans.
I guess.
Well...we're real cheap.
Skip.
You working for Hooper?
How do you know about Lacey?
Little prick...what'd he tell you?
Did he show you his "Home Study Course"?
Yeah I bet he did.
He is an idiot...or he was...he's dead now. He was a paranormal whore. Always trying to get into the spotlight, yak, yak yaking. We took an oath. We don't divulge...
We...don't...divulge.
Okay. Let me ask you something.
You were in there for hours. What color were the chairs?
They were green. How many lights are there in this room?
A Super Soldier wouldn't need to look. He would just know.

A Jedi Warrior. He would know where all the lights were. He could walk through a room and tell you how many power outlets there were. People are walking around with their eyes closed. At Level One we were trained to instantly absorb all details.
You're looking at one.
That's correct.
I'm Sergeant First Class Lyn Cassady, Special Forces, retired.
Soldiers with Super Powers. We were the first generation of the New Earth Army.
That's correct.
We prefer the term Remote Viewer.
Different Jedi had different techniques. Mel Landau used to visualize packing all his cares and worries in a little suitcase, to clear his mind. Steve Cuttle used to read Bible verse...
Well, I find drinking helps. Also if I'm listening to classic rock music.
I like Boston. Boston usually works.
Invisibility.
Yup. That was Level Three.
Well...yeah, that was the goal.

It's not like camouflage. We also practised Phasing. Crossing from particle to wave, from the physical realm to the plane of energy. Solid objects seem to pass right through you. It's starts with a breathing exercise...
Then you think black. That's the nothingness.
Not going to happen.
Not going to happen.
I'm shipping out tomorrow.
Going to Iraq. There's this factory we might be partnering with in Al Qaim.
What?
Bob, I don't want to be a story, okay? I don't need the attention and...
It's a war over there Bob. Okay? A war. I can't be looking out for you.
What's this?
Nothing.
that book.
You see it?
Yeah?
I don't know where to begin.
Bill always said it started for him when he fell out of a helicopter in Vietnam.
What?
No.
It cooks supper.
Solar. Utilizing the power of the universe - no pollution, totally renewable. This is like New Earth Army technology.
Pretty mind-blowing, isn't it?
What?
Go on - what?

The New Earth Army was tasked with preventing conflict. We're a force of peace, not war. Bill realized if you want to change the world, you've got to start by changing the armies. He was the one that started the research into non-
Check this out.
The Predator.
You see? You're mine now. The Predator is completely biodegradable. It's friendly to the earth but it can hurt you in a hundred ways.
And it looks a bit funny. This is New Earth Army technology.
I bought it on line. What's cool about it is that you could see this lying on the ground and you'd never know it had such lethality.
Eyeballs.
Piece'a shit.
I've got Crohn's. The steroids help.
Sometimes there's a need, Bob. Sometimes people are calling out for something, even if they don't know it themselves. And then a man like Bill appears out of nowhere, because he heard the call....
What?
Salute to the Sun.
Cloud bursting. Keeps me in shape.
That one.
No. That one. The big one.
They're all far away.
And it's gone.
Yeah. I'm sorry about that Bob.
Yeah.
I don't think they're Al Qaeda.

Bob, there's something I have to tell you. When I said I was retired from the unit, that was a lie. I'm on a mission. DeWitts was just my cover. I've been reactivated. I couldn't tell you because this is a Black Op, but...I think you have a part to play. I think that's why you're with me.

Your life is like a river, Bob. If you're aiming for a goal that isn't your destiny, you will always be swimming against the current. Young Ghandi wants to be a stock-car racer? Not gonna happen. Little Anne Frank wants to be a High School teacher. Tough titty Anne. That's not your destiny. But you will go on to move the hearts and minds of millions. Find out what your destiny is and the river will carry you. Now sometimes events in life give an individual clues as to where their Destiny lies.
Like those doodles you just "happened" to draw?
This is the Ajna chakra - the third eye - the symbol of the Jedi. When I saw you'd drawn it...well, the Universe gives me a sign like that, I don't ignore it.
Now listen to me. I don't think these guys are FRL's or Mehdi Army... I think we're talking standard criminals here, okay?
We're Jedi, Bob. The Jedi don't fight with guns. We fight with our minds.
Let's say we have no choice but to fight with these men. Then we use visual aesthetics to instill psychically in the enemy a disincentive to attack.
Okay, you lock eyes with one of them, you go into a monotone and you say "No, I'm not going to attack you." You totally relax your body and your voice. And then you rip out one of his eyeballs.
Or you use a pen, stab him in the neck, create a fountain of blood, I mean really a fountain, get the blood to squirt on his buddies.
You're missing the point.
Here let me show you something. Stand up.
Choke me.
Choke me. What am I gonna do?
Just here. Choke. Choke.
Bob stares at him, a little annoyed by this.
Quit jawing, Bob, and choke me.
I'm going to interrupt your thought pattern.
You felt fear didn't you? Before hand?
Would you say that level of fear was abnormal for you?
You know why? It wasn't you. It was me. I was inside your head.
That's okay. You learnt a lesson.
Oprah.
Just my cover.
No. I do run a dance school. I love dance.
In time, Bob.
We learn to recognize our own kind after a while. You ever dream about flying?
That's one of the signs.
Don't you? Haven't you always really felt you were different?
That's the way it is for us. We're the ones who don't fit in as kids.
Kind of. They used to call me the Jinx.
Yes sir.
Lyn Cassady sir.
Opelousas, Louisiana, sir.
Not much of a dancer sir.
It's a man on a chair.

We're north of Verona. It's a little town. There's a lake nearby. I can see a Cinema. Across from the Cinema is a shop or, or...it's a cafe. He's in the apartment above. The town is called...it's something sweet.
Dolce. It's called Dolce.
It's okay, Bob. We're not getting into that truck.
Don't move Bob.
Let's hope it doesn't come to that.
You can put your weapon away.
Stay where you are Bob.
We can go about our business.
Ben, you're not forgotten. The knife you gave me lies next to my beret. God bless Ben Echmeyer.
There he is.
Sir? You're okay! We're Americans.
Oh crap!
I think I just ran him over.
give me a hand here will you?
What's Krom?
Really? Is that Norse?
Right.
What is this?
They're really good.
I'm very sorry for running you over, sir.
And I apologize for that security detachment. Please don't think all Americans are like that.
Not your fault sir. I mean we get kidnappers in America too, so...you know. There's always, uh, bad apples, right?
Mahmud looks at him, startled perhaps by the unexpected Arabic phrase.
Did I say it wrong?
What?
Just Mahmud. People try to build something of their lives, something lasting, something good... but there's always someone wants to smash it up...
I really appreciate this sir.
Bedouins have been navigating this desert for centuries without maps.
What?
I haven't got a watch.
This is a digital watch, Bob.
So you need a watch with hands for Christ's sake!
Will, if you'd just be quiet for a...
Will you shut up? I don't need a watch. I'm using Level Two.
Level Two. Intuition. We were trained to make correct decisions.
Just like that.
Yes. It's this way.
IED.
Improvised Explosive Device.
You're okay Bob. It's gonna be okay.
Alright, c'mon...
Fedayeen will find us first.
Fedayeen Saddam. Paramilitary.
Could be IED's or mines around here. I'm checking for disturbances in the telluric current.
Bob? It's pretty important you keep your mouth closed, okay? You can lose a lot of water through an open mouth.
You're okay.
You're not bleeding to death, Bob.
You're going to be okay.
Bob, you're suffering from shock.
The mission isn't in Al Qaim. It's somewhere near Al Qaim.
I don't know.
If the exact whereabouts of the Target was known it wouldn't take a Jedi to find them, would it?
Bill did.
Bill did. He appeared in my trailer two months ago. A psychic projection. I could hear him calling my name.
He needed me.
I don't have Crohns.
I'm dying.
I've been murdered.
It's gone Bob. I can't find him.
They took this... beautiful thing we'd been building and they corrupted it. They destroyed the New Earth Army.
I did.
This was the real deal, Bob. I was at the Gateway. Afterwards I realized I'd got injured.
Sympathetic injury I guess. I was bruised all over.
Goat didn't have a chance.
I wish it was. Hooper told Holtz we should try the experiment again. Only this time they said...kill the goat.
There was no way! What had the goat ever done to me? It was totally against the way of the Jedi. I was just going to pretend to try so they would say, "okay -
You know what I keep thinking?
Maybe deep down inside some dark part of me wanted to see if I could do it?
it. I'd used my powers for evil and it was like I brought a curse upon us all. Like that poem where the guy kills the seagull and they make him wear it round his neck.
I finished my tour and I quit. I walked out of the unit and I never went back.
What do you wan...?
What the hell?
The Dim Mak. The Quivering Palm.
It kills you Bob. With one touch.

There's a story that Wong Wifu, great Chinese martial artist, had a fight with some guy and had him beat when the guy gave him this light tap, and Wong looked at him and the guy just nodded. That was it. He'd given him the death touch and Wong died.
No. Eighteen years later. That's the weird thing with Dim Mak - you never know when it's going to take effect.
Hello Bill.
This is Bob.
I remote viewed you.
You're working for him?
It's the Dark Side.
It's too late...I'm dying, Bob.
Dim Mak.
It's cancer.
I mean, I know it was caused by the Dim Mak. But...it's...you know...it's cancer. That's what the doctors say. Different ways of looking at...different names for a reality or, or uh...
I shouldn't have come Bob.
...Give this back to Bill...I don't deserve it.
Just tired.
I told you. I remote viewed you.
No.
I haven't seen Scotty.
What?
What's going on?
